snippet: Eric S. Maskin, the Harvard economics professor and Nobel laureate, explains why the patent system should be scrapped in the case of software.
abstract: Letter from Eric S Maskin, Harvard economics professor and 2007 Nobel laureate, responds to Oct 8 article exploring how flaws in the software patent system can impede, rather than promote, innovation.
lead_paragraph: Eric S. Maskin, the Harvard economics professor and Nobel laureate, explains why the patent system should be scrapped in the case of software.

headline.main: Patents on Software: A Nobel Laureate’s View
headline.print_headline: Patents on Software: A Nobel Laureate’s View
